Tasks.Task: Create a virtual network and virtual network gateway
Tasks.Task Description: Create a virtual network and virtual network gateway if you haven't already. This is a prerequisite for setting up the connection between the virtual network gateway and your ExpressRoute circuit.

Tasks.Task: Set up the connection between the virtual network gateway and ExpressRoute circuit
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Terraform script or PowerShell command to configure the connection between the virtual network gateway and your ExpressRoute circuit.
Verify your network configuration by selecting 'Get ARP Records' and 'Get route table' under the ExpressRoute Private peering page in the Azure portal.
Enable ExpressRoute Fast Path to access your Azure Large Instances servers from anywhere, including Azure VMs and on-premises.
To see the learned routes from Azure Large Instances, look at the Effective Routes table of one of your VMs in the Azure portal.
Ensure that accelerated networking is enabled with all VMs connecting to Azure Large Instances.
Set up volume groups as part of your Azure Large Instances solution based on your system requirements.

Tasks.Task: Set up storage snapshot, backup, and data offload
Tasks.Task Description: Set up a storage snapshot, backup, and data offload after all data-intensive work is complete to avoid creating unnecessary snapshots.
If you don't see your Azure Large Instances deployment under your subscription, register the resource provider with your subscription.
Create and modify an ExpressRoute circuit as needed for your project.
Set up and modify the peering configuration for your ExpressRoute circuit.

Tasks.Task: Link a VNet to an ExpressRoute circuit
Tasks.Task Description: Link your virtual network to an ExpressRoute circuit to establish connectivity.

Tasks.Task: Customize metrics and create a Connection Monitor
Tasks.Task Description: Customize your metrics and create a Connection Monitor to track the performance and reliability of your ExpressRoute connection.
Consider connectivity design, networking mechanisms, secure connections, data exfiltration, and integration with other cloud data sources or compute engines.
Evaluate regulatory requirements, user authorization, authentication, and network security requirements for both analytical compute and storage.
Review Azure networking components like network security groups (NSGs) for proper connectivity and data movement.
Consider integration with private DNS zones for your network design.

Tasks.Task: Browse data lake from Synapse Studio
Tasks.Task Description: Determine if you need to browse the data lake from within Synapse Studio or simply query data in the data lake with serverless SQL or PolyBase.

Tasks.Task: Identify data consumers and verify connectivity
Tasks.Task Description: Identify all data consumers and verify that their connectivity is accounted for in the network design.

Tasks.Task: Set up ExpressRoute for Microsoft PSTN services
Tasks.Task Description: Create ExpressRoute Microsoft Peering to route traffic to Microsoft PSTN services.
